description: Functions to access the post-execution profiling information of a query. Only available, if profiling is enabled.

comment.description: Returns the root node of the profiling information. Returns nullptr, if profiling is not enabled.

Returns the value of the metric of the current profiling info node. Returns nullptr, if the metric does
 not exist or is not enabled. Currently, the value holds a string, and you can retrieve the string
 by calling the corresponding function: char *duckdb_get_varchar(duckdb_value value).

param_comments.key: The name of the requested metric.

comment.return_value: The value of the metric. Must be freed with `duckdb_destroy_value`

comment.description:
Returns the key-value metric map of this profiling node as a MAP duckdb_value.
The individual elements are accessible via the duckdb_value MAP functions.
comment.return_value: The key-value metric map as a MAP duckdb_value.

comment.description: Returns the number of children in the current profiling info node.
comment.return_value: The number of children in the current node.

comment.description: Returns the child node at the specified index.

param_comments.index: The index of the child node.

comment.return_value: The child node at the specified index.
